name: Engagement Emails
description: system fires emails to encourage users to engage, eg. user signed up but hasn't created anything, bundle notifications and send daily reminder where non-zero list

name: Anti-slam Emails
description: we don't want to send an email every time a comment comes through

name: Feed for people that haven't followed
description: When user has no follows, show a useful feed (e.g. explore-style or curated) instead of empty.

name: BUG: scroll resetting (some browsers)
description: Fix scroll position reset on some browsers (e.g. feed/detail/nav).

name: Make follow easier
description: General UX pass to make following creators easier (visibility, one-click where appropriate).

description: Rate limiting and abuse controls for anonymous/try generation only (e.g. by IP/cookie, caps).

name: Invite credits
description: Grant starter credits on invite acceptance; record inviter and source.

name: Share method QR Code
description: Add QR code as a share option so users can share a link via scannable QR (e.g. in share modal).

name: Landing: community creations iamges
description: Show example or featured community creations to anonymous visitors (no login).

name: Generate from uploaded image
description: Main create flow: user uploads an image and generates from it (img2img); wire upload to provider payload and create UI.

name: Search comments/descriptions/prompts
description: Full-text search over creation metadata: comments, descriptions, prompts.

name: Creation Detail Related Images
description: images that are similar or related after fold

name: Credit Purchase
description: users can buy credits using real money

description:
The original creator gets some credits.
The sharer gets credits.

description: Lineage view shows children (derivatives/remixes) and a graph visualization.

description: Server-scoped boosts increase owner's credit yield with caps, no discovery lift.

name: Invites & redemption
description: Optional invite welcome flow via email or shareable token, with stored invite context.
